qas.question: What did Piers Morgan offer opinions about in a late 1980s column?

answers.text: the sexuality of male pop stars

qas.question: Which papers did Morgan serve as editor of?

answers.text: Daily Mirror and of The Sun

qas.question: Which BBC show's homosexual kiss did The Sun report on?
Who shared the first homosexual kiss on EastEnders?
Which column did Piers Morgan edit at The Sun?

context: Television personality Piers Morgan, a former editor of the <a1_0>Daily Mirror and of The Sun<a1_0/>'s <a4_0>Bizarre pop column<a4_0/>, has said that during the late 1980s, at Kelvin MacKenzie's behest, he was ordered to speculate on <a0_0>the sexuality of male pop stars<a0_0/> for a feature headlined "The Poofs of Pop". He also recalls MacKenzie headlining a January 1989 story about the first same-sex kiss on the BBC television soap opera <a2_0>EastEnders<a2_0/> "EastBenders", describing the kiss between <a3_0>Colin Russell and Guido Smith<a3_0/> as "a homosexual love scene between yuppie poofs ... when millions of children were watching".
